messages.message: @Ram Prasanna lets remove the "IN REVIEW" state for now and add it back after automation is fixed.
IN PROGRESS still shows up at the top of the todo list in Jira though. Annoying, but I suppose I can always make a filter instead.
Also not possible to distinguish between “working on a fix” and “potential fix merged” which is a problem

I also find it quite hard to believe that there’s no way to create a parent ticket for the CVE if it doesn’t exist, and then assign that as a parent to every new vtest ticket for that CVE. But I trust that y’all have done your research.

Hey @mfichman, the current logic treats each vulnerability as a unique issue. Creating categories for these issues would require additional logic, and closing a parent ticket would necessitate even more complex logic.

To sum it up, treating each issue individually is simpler and avoids unnecessary complexity. Another potential issue is that if someone wants to know the status of a child issue, they would have to find the parent ticket first, which can be cumbersome.
Also if the issue here is the redundancy of comment multiple tickets you can achieve this by bulk editing the issues. There is an option to add a comment based on a filter you can try it out.
If you say so! Anyway, where is the multi-ticket comment feature? I don't see it in Jira.

@mfichman @Yash Botadra Thanks for the inputs, we will definitely prioritise the low-hanging fruits. Keep those feedback coming.

Plz do understand that some complexity and priority may not be apparent when the backend is changing constantly with the scanner outputs and underlying vulnerabilities. Be assured we will get to these tweaks. In fact will schedule a session to understand your feedback better.

For bulk jira edits :
• create a filter or use the one given in <#C02Q8S53J10|> like - https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C02Q8S53J10/p1718360842982749?thread_ts=1718360841.518739&cid=C02Q8S53J10
• tweak the filter to select the sub-list of tickets you want to add comments to.
• Click on top right three dots to get the bulk change option. PFA screenshot attached.
• follow the on-screen instructions from Step-1 to step-4 for the bulk change. 
May be there are some other ways to achieve the same results but this is as far as my jira proficiency goes.
